oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Doug Sahm Live at the Lone Star Café - 1978-09-21 - Reel 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from the Lone Star Café live show. The tape features a live performance of Doug Sahm (musician). The Lone Star Café show is presented by Mort Cooperman, Bill McGivney and the WHN radio network. The recording of Doug Sahm is from September 21, 1978. The reel is labeled as the second reel of two. The end of the tape features performances by Waylon Jennings (musician) and T. G. Sheppard (musician).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Doug Sahm
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:11) Alan Colmes addresses the crowd and introduces Doug Sahm -- (01:00) Dealer's Blues (Doug Sahm) -- (04:45) Sometimes (Doug Sahm) -- (08:52) High Heel Sneakers (Doug Sahm) -- (13:16) Sahm greets the audience and discusses the upcoming show -- (13:57) Hippies are Leaving Texas and Going to San Francisco [unconfirmed] (Doug Sahm) -- (17:54) She's About a Mover (Doug Sahm) -- (23:37) Things I Used to Do (Doug Sahm) -- (28:28) Cowboy Peyton Place (Doug Sahm) -- (33:16) The Moody Blues (Doug Sahm) -- (35:40) Think About it Baby [unconfirmed] (Doug Sahm) -- (40:00) It's Not Love (But it's Not Bad) (Doug Sahm) -- (43:22) Is Anybody Going to Antone (Doug Sahm) -- (47:50) Honky Tonk Women (Doug Sahm) -- (51:48) Georgia on My Mind (Doug Sahm) -- (56:09) In the Still of the Life (Doug Sahm) -- (59:42) The Great Pretender (Doug Sahm) -- (1:01:29) An unidentified host introduces Waylon Jennings -- (1:01:38) Are You Sure Hank Done it This Way (Waylon Jennings) -- (1:07:22) Sheppard asks the crowd to listen to his story about working for Elvis Presley -- (1:09:02) C. C. Rider (T. G. Sheppard) -- (1:11:10) T. G. Sheppard introduces his band -- (1:12:39) Lee Arnold says goodbye to the audience
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Sahm, Doug; Jennings, Waylon; Sheppard, T. G.;
